title: SCOTUS Right to Bear Arms Amendment

content.description: In McDonald v. Chicago (2010), the United States Supreme Court stated that, “[s]elf-defense is a basic right, recognized by many legal systems from ancient times to the present day” and that an individual’s right to bear arms was “deeply rooted in this Nation’s history and tradition.”
content.question: The quote points to which of the following amendments to the United States Constitution as a basis to limit state action?

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain how a required Supreme Court case relates to a foundational document or to other primary or secondary sources.
